code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:28 year old male presents via EMS 3 days following MVA. he was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head. Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 15 mph on impact. patient c/o mild dizziness, moderate nausea, moderate neck pain and Traumatic Injury - Blunt.No loss of consciousness o:Height 65 in, Weight 124 lbs, Temperature 97.9 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, NAD, Neck = supple w/o TTP, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL w/ no deficits, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Psych = Mood, affect NL, appropriate judgement a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:m respiratory therapist aged 28 ys presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion. he denies nausea, dizziness and neck pain. Furthermore, he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 65 in, Weight 124 lbs, Temperature 97.8 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, HEENT = NCAT, PERRL, C/V = RRR, Abd = Soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Neck = Supple, Pulm = CTAB. Good respiratory effort, MS = Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with no loss of consciousness). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Neck = Supple , Pulm = CTAB
